objectives: Use core classifiers CL:1 (person/thin object), CL:3 (vehicle), and CL:B (flat surface/object) in short, clear clauses
Place and move classifiers in space with readable paths, orientation, and size
Describe simple scenes (person walking, car turning, object on table) with time-first framing

vocab.def: Index-finger classifier for a person, thin/long thing; shows path, direction, speed.
3-handshape for vehicles (car, bus); shows direction, turn, stop.
Flat B-hand for surfaces/flat objects (table, paper), doors/walls.
Place items, face them correctly, then move along a visible path.
Mouth/face show fast/slow, small/big while hands stay compact.
Set WHEN first (TODAY, PAST, FUTURE) for scene clarity.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Handshape Isolation
sections.body: Form **CL:1, CL:3, CL:B**â€”freeze each for 2 seconds. Check: wrist neutral, fingers crisp, small comfortable space.

microCheck.q: Which classifier best represents a car?

sections.heading: Model: Place â†’ Orient â†’ Move
sections.body:
Use a **3-beat**: 1) **PLACE** object, 2) **ORIENT** (which way it faces), 3) **MOVE** with a clear **PATH**. Examples:
â€¢ **TODAY CL:B-TABLE. CL:1 PERSON STAND-LEFT. WALKâ†’RIGHT (slow).**
â€¢ **PAST CL:3 CAR PLACE-CENTER. TURN-LEFT. STOP.**
sections.teacherNote: Coach tiny path arcs and clear stop points; avoid huge travel.

sections.heading: Perspective: Top-Down vs Front
sections.body: For **CL:3**, choose a view: **top-down** (map-like turns) or **front** (car coming toward/away). Stay consistent within a scene.

callouts.title: Lock the Camera
callouts.body: Pick one perspective per scene; switching mid-way confuses viewers.

microCheck.q: How to keep perspective clear in a car scene?
options: Choose one (top-down or front) and stick with it

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Three Micro-Scenes
sections.body:
Scene A (**CL:1**): **TODAY PERSON WALK STRAIGHT â†’ STOP.** 
Scene B (**CL:3**): **PAST CAR TURN-RIGHT â†’ PARK.** 
Scene C (**CL:B**): **PAPER ON TABLE; SLIDEâ†’LEFT.** Add NMM for speed/effort; keep clauses 3â€“5 signs.

callouts.title: Overuse
callouts.body: Donâ€™t replace every noun with a classifierâ€”introduce once, then use CL for movement/placement.

microCheck.q: Best way to introduce a classifier referent:
options: Name once (CAR), then shift to CL:3 for movement

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body:
Record **12â€“18s** choosing **one**: 
â€¢ **PERSON (CL:1) path** with start/stop, 
â€¢ **CAR (CL:3) turn/park**, or 
â€¢ **OBJECT (CL:B) slide/stack**. Use **TIME-FIRST** and the **placeâ†’orientâ†’move** rhythm.

items.q: Best classifier for a person walking:
What parameter most clearly shows direction/turn?
Write a gloss: TODAY CAR TURN-LEFT PARK (use CL:3 after naming once).

items.prompt: Which was harderâ€”keeping paths small/clean or choosing a consistent perspective? What cue will you practice?

summary: You introduced and used CL:1, CL:3, and CL:B to place, orient, and move referents in small scenes with clear paths and perspective.
